bugs.title: [abrt] midori: WebCore::SQLiteStatement::prepare(): midori killed by SIGSEGV

bugzilla.short_desc: [abrt] midori: WebCore::SQLiteStatement::prepare(): midori killed by SIGSEGV

long_desc.thetext:
Description of problem:
Set Midori to clear private data on exit. Next run it crashed on exit.

Version-Release number of selected component:
midori-0.5.9-2.fc21

Additional info:
reporter:       libreport-2.3.0
backtrace_rating: 4
cmdline:        midori
crash_function: WebCore::SQLiteStatement::prepare
executable:     /usr/bin/midori
kernel:         3.18.5-201.fc21.i686
runlevel:       N 5
type:           CCpp
uid:            1000

Truncated backtrace:
Thread no. 1 (10 frames)
 #0 WebCore::SQLiteStatement::prepare at Source/WebCore/platform/sql/SQLiteStatement.cpp:81
 #1 WebCore::SQLiteStatement::executeCommand at Source/WebCore/platform/sql/SQLiteStatement.cpp:137
 #2 WebCore::SQLiteDatabase::executeCommand at Source/WebCore/platform/sql/SQLiteDatabase.cpp:272
 #3 WebCore::SQLiteTransaction::begin at Source/WebCore/platform/sql/SQLiteTransaction.cpp:67
 #4 WebCore::IconDatabase::writeToDatabase at Source/WebCore/loader/icon/IconDatabase.cpp:1615
 #5 WebCore::IconDatabase::syncThreadMainLoop at Source/WebCore/loader/icon/IconDatabase.cpp:1384
 #6 WebCore::IconDatabase::iconDatabaseSyncThread at Source/WebCore/loader/icon/IconDatabase.cpp:1041
 #7 WebCore::IconDatabase::iconDatabaseSyncThreadStart at Source/WebCore/loader/icon/IconDatabase.cpp:962
 #8 WTF::threadEntryPoint at Source/WTF/wtf/Threading.cpp:69
 #9 WTF::wtfThreadEntryPoint at Source/WTF/wtf/ThreadingPthreads.cpp:170

Created attachment 988317
File: backtrace

Created attachment 988318
File: cgroup

Created attachment 988319
File: core_backtrace

Created attachment 988320
File: dso_list

Created attachment 988321
File: environ

Created attachment 988322
File: exploitable

Created attachment 988323
File: limits

Created attachment 988324
File: maps

Created attachment 988325
File: open_fds

Created attachment 988326
File: proc_pid_status

Created attachment 988327
File: var_log_messages
Can you duplicate the crash if you do that again?

Seemingly not. I've been trying to today while waiting for Google to fix Chrome Stable. It may have been a one off. The report was generated and submitted via the Problem Reporting program after the crash triggered it.

However this build of Midori 0.5.9 seems not to be able to clear all private data on exit. I have all the options ticked but when I open Midori again it opens the last page visited. This should not be happening.

I don't normally use Midori so not sure if that not clearing private data glitch on exit was an existing bug.

Created attachment 988589
Crash report screenshot

It crashed again just now. Attached is a screenshot of the report to serve as proof. It won't upload the reports again for the same bug.

Created attachment 988602
2nd screenshot

Sites visited which may/may not be relevant to the crashing on attempting to clear data on/before exit:

http://www.locatetv.com/uk/listings

https://plus.google.com

ok. I will try and see if I can make something of the crash data. 

Thanks for reporting this!
